verses.text: O give thanks unto the \sc Lord\sc*; call upon his name: Make known his deeds among the people.
Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: Talk ye of all his wondrous works.
Glory ye in his holy name: Let the heart of them rejoice that seek the \sc Lord\sc*.
Seek the \sc Lord\sc*, and his strength: Seek his face evermore.
Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
O ye seed of Abraham his servant, Ye children of Jacob, his chosen.
He \add is\add* the \sc Lord\sc* our God: His judgments \add are\add* in all the earth.
He hath remembered his covenant for ever, The word \add which\add* he commanded to a thousand generations.
Which \add covenant\add* he made with Abraham, And his oath unto Isaac;
And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, \add And\add* to Israel \add for\add* an everlasting covenant:
Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, The lot of your inheritance:
When they were \add but a few\add* men in number; Yea, \add very\add* few, and strangers in it.
When they went from one nation to another, From \add one\add* kingdom to another people;
He suffered no man to do them wrong: Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;
\add Saying\add*, Touch not mine anointed, And do my prophets no harm.
Moreover, he called \add for\add* a famine upon the land: He brake the whole staff of bread.
He sent a man before them, \add Even\add* Joseph, \add who\add* was sold for a servant:
Whose feet they hurt with fetters: He was laid \add in\add* iron:
Until the time that his word came: The word of the \sc Lord\sc* tried him.
The king sent and loosed him; \add Even\add* the ruler of the people, and let him go free.
He made him lord of his house, And ruler of all his substance:
To bind his princes at his pleasure; And teach his senators wisdom.
Israel also came \add into\add* Egypt; And Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
And he increased his people greatly; And made them stronger than their enemies.
He turned their heart to hate his people, To deal subtilly with his servants.
He sent Moses his servant; \add And\add* Aaron whom he had chosen.
They shewed his signs among them, And wonders in the land of Ham.
He sent darkness, and made it dark; And they rebelled not against his word.
He turned their waters into blood, And slew their fish.
Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, In the chambers of their kings.
He spake, and there came divers sorts \add of flies\add*, \add And\add* lice in all their coasts.
He gave them hail \add for\add* rain, \add And\add* flaming fire in their land.
He smote their vines also and their fig trees; And brake the trees of their coasts.
He spake, and the locusts came, And caterpillars, and that without number,
And did eat up all the herbs in their land, And devoured the fruit of their ground.
He smote also all the first-born in their land, The chief of all their strength.
He brought them forth also with silver and gold: And \add there was\add* not \add one\add* feeble \add person\add* among their tribes.
Egypt was glad when they departed: For the fear of them that fell upon them.
He spread a cloud for a covering; And fire to give light in the night.
\add The people\add* asked, and he brought quails, And satisfied them \add with\add* the bread of heaven.
He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; They ran in the dry \add places like\add* a river.
For he remembered his holy promise, \add And\add* Abraham his servant.
And he brought forth his people with joy, \add And\add* his chosen with gladness:
And gave them the lands of the heathen: And they inherited the labour of the people;
That they might observe his statutes, And keep his laws. Praise ye the \sc Lord\sc*.
